alert.note: Alert for La Crosse; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 8:27AM CDT until October 30 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. Black River Near Galesville affecting Trempealeau and La Crosse Counties. .The Black River at Black River Falls has crested. Additional precipitation last night and today are not expected to produce additional rises. Water will continue to rise downstream at Galesville through Friday night. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River near Galesville. * WHEN...From this evening to Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 14.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 04/03/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
